discussion.content:
The cost report is automatically generated daily, and is stored in an Oracle-owned Object Storage bucket. It contains one row per each Oracle Cloud Infrastructure resource (such as instance, Object Storage bucket, VNIC) per hour along with consumption information (usage, price, cost), metadata, and tags. Cost reports generally contain 24 hours of usage data, although occasionally a cost report may contain late-arriving data that is older than 24 hours.
And Retention is for one year.
B. Daily the most frequent option

questions.question_text: What is frequency of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Usage Report generation?

You were recently assigned to manage a project to deploy Oracle E-Business Suite on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). The application will require a database, several servers, and a shared file system.
Which three OCI services are best suited for this project? (Choose three.)

choices.D: Virtual Machine (VM) or Bare Metal (BM) compute instances
choices.E: OCI virtual or Bare Metal DB Systems

discussion.content: C,D,E I believe is the answer because it has to cater for servers
CDE is correct. Instances are servers

Extract from : https://docs.oracle.com/en/solutions/deploy-ebusiness-suite-oci/index.html#GUID-85F909BC-B533-44DA-9118-F05CDE29A281
Application tier: This tier contains more than one instance of an Oracle E-Business Suite application to provide high availability. Set up multiple instances of an application in separate fault domain to ensure that you can continue accessing the application even if an application instance goes down.

Oracle recommends deploying the Oracle E-Business Suite multitier setup with shared application binaries. Use Oracle Cloud Infrastructure File Storage to create a shared file system to share Oracle E-Business Suite application binaries.

Database tier: This tier contains Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Database instances. For high availability requirements, Oracle recommends using a 2-node Virtual Machine (VM) DB system or Exadata DB System.

Correct answer should CDE because your needs File Storage service for the shared file systems, VM or Bare Metal compute instances for the applicatiion-tier and VM or Bare Metal DB systems for the database.
BCE doesn't allow deploying application servers for E-Business Suite.

I would say B,C and D "Virtual Machine (VM) or Bare Metal (BM) compute instances"
As they need to migrate the whole eBS (application and Database) so They need a VM for the Application, which won't be available for DB systems.
Would you please correct me?

I would say B,C and D "Virtual Machine (VM) or Bare Metal (BM) compute instances"
As they need to migrate the whe eBS (application and Database) so They need a VM for the Application, which won't be available for DB systems.
Would you please correct me?
C, D and E to align with the services
CDE is correct, Compute instances are required for running application(s)
CDE because its a SHARED File system

OCI virtual or Bare Metal DB Systems
Virtual Machine (VM) or Bare Metal (BM) compute Instances
File Storage Service
there is no way an Oracel eBiz suite will not have Compute servers, so D is needed for sure. Object storage is a good-to-have only, not necessary something that an legacy app can fully leverage.

I think it has to be C, D, & E. EBS will require servers for the application tier, servers for the database tier and storage for the files. The link referenced talks about Object storage for database backups

As per my reading BCE, if someone can confirm from Below Document.
https://docs.oracle.com/en/solutions/deploy-ebusiness-suite-oci/index.html#GUID-7947C700-D668-4BB3-8028-A0153F30E13A

comments.content:
OCI refers to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, which has Virtual and Bare Metal DB Systems
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Database/Concepts/overview.htm

discussion.content: BCD since there aren't any OCI Virtual DB systems. Trick question

I would say BCD. Because Oracle recommends using a 2-node Virtual Machine (VM) DB system or Exadata DB System. Doesnt mention Bare metal. However for compute instance, this is pretty much open and you will require one for Bastion host.

questions.question_text: What characteristics are defined by an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute shape?

choices.B: Number of vCPU, amount of RAM, bandwidth
choices.A: Availability Domain and Fault Domain locations
choices.C: Number of OCPU, amount of RAM, bandwidth
choices.D: Public or private visibility of the Compute instance

discussion.content: C: OCPU "Not VCPU", Memory and Network Bandwidth are determined by setting the instance shape
C is the correct Answer - VPN is faster than FastConnect to Provision.
Correct. It's about here a site to site connexion
C. IpSec VPN is the fastest option to achieve the objective

comments.content: Hello. Internet Gateway is a service to cennect an Server to public internet. Isn't a secure connection to on-premisses.

discussion.content: FastConnect is a physical connect CU-Oracle.... and it is not a quick thing to do. It is faster to connect a VPN

comments.content:
For POC and quick setup C is correct.

questions.question_text: Which describes a key benefit of using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)?

choices.B: With OCI, you can only run Java based workloads on bare metal.
choices.D: With OCI, you can run only cloud-native workloads.
choices.C: Only bare metal workloads are supported on OCI.
choices.A: OCI offers consistent performance with a predictable pricing model.
